purpose: Provide a consistent and enforceable approach to recording audit events across WyneOS.

auditPrinciples.accuracy: Audit entries must reflect true system activity.
auditPrinciples.completeness: All relevant events must be recorded.
auditPrinciples.immutability: Audit data must not be modified after creation.
auditPrinciples.traceability: Audit entries must provide clear links to their source events.

fields.timestamp: UTC timestamp of when the event occurred.
fields.source: Module or engine where the event originated.
fields.state: System mode at the time of the event.
fields.hash: Integrity hash of the audit entry for immutability.

storage.fileFormat: text or JSON depending on the event type
storage.rotation: New audit file created weekly or when the file reaches size threshold
storage.retention: Audit files kept permanently unless archived

validationRules.timestampOrder: Audit entries must follow chronological order.
validationRules.hashCheck: Each audit entry must generate a hash on creation.
validationRules.fileIntegrity: Audit files must pass integrity checks before being accepted.

failureActions.missingAudit: Write system warning and escalate to AssuranceEngine.
failureActions.invalidEntry: Reject entry and log the validation failure.
failureActions.repeatedFailure: Switch to controlled mode and halt non-essential engines.

summary.statement: This audit policy ensures WyneOS remains accountable and verifiable across all operations. It defines how events are recorded, validated, and preserved.
